ai.summary: A short, easy 0.6 km hike on the Carn Brea FP 37 Ground Truth route in the UK. Designed for quick, low-effort outdoor time and suitable for families and casual walkers, with a gentle pace and straightforward paths.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily compacted earth and gravel paths with a few gentle slopes. The route is mostly level and well maintained, with occasional uneven patches and small steps on certain sections.
ai.safety_notes: - Check weather and daylight before you go. - Wear sturdy shoes and bring a light layer for changing conditions. - Stay on marked paths and be mindful of other walkers, cyclists, and any road crossings. - Keep children under supervision and avoid steep edges. - Carry water and a charged phone; know how to contact help if needed. - Respect wildlife and local guidelines.
recommended_gear: Phone with offline map or trail app
ai.best_seasons: All year round, with especially pleasant conditions in spring and summer; plan for possible mud in wet seasons.
